org.xflatdb.xflat

Annotation Type Id


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface Id
    Marks one java bean property as the ID. The ID will be uniquely generated and assigned if it does not already exist.

    The value() property instructs XFlat that this object serializes its ID property to the XML Element, and gives the XPath expression that should be treated as equivalent to XPathQuery.Id when XFlat inspects a query.

    Example (inside class Foo):

    • 



      Element Detail
      




        

      • 

        value
        

        public abstract java.lang.String value
        

        The XPath expression which selects this property once it has been converted to an Element.
 
        
 This tells XFlat that this expression is equivalent to XPathQuery.Id, so that XFlat can
 apply optimizations based on ID if it encounters this expression in a query.
        
 This must be the exact same expression used in queries in order for XFlat to match it.
 
        
 If this is not set, the PojoConverter will be invoked to take a "best guess".
        

        Returns:
        The string value of the raw XPath selecting the ID in a query.
        

        

        Default:
        

        ""
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        namespaces
        

        public abstract java.lang.String[] namespaces
        

        A set of XML namespace declarations that declare the namespaces used
 in the XPath expression.  If the value() expression includes
 a namespace, this must declare the namespace.
        
 Example:
        
 
         xmlns:a="http://www.example.com/ns"
 
        

        Returns:
        An array of namespaces used in the XPath expression.
        

        

        Default:
        

        ""
